title: Vermont Is One Step Closer to Adding Abortion Rights to Its Constitution
sub_head: If voters approve constitutional amendment in November, it would make state first in U.S. to have such protections
body:
Vermont lawmakers approved a state constitutional amendment on Tuesday enshrining abortion rights, the culmination of a yearslong legislative effort that could make the New England state the first in the U.S. with such protections.
Voters will have final say on the amendment, known as the Right to Personal Reproductive Autonomy Amendment, or Proposition 5, on the ballot in November. The proposal would establish a person’s “right to personal reproductive autonomy,” which would include protections around abortion, birth control access and sterilization.
